description: The function is vulnerable to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks. This is because it directly inserts user-controlled input into HTML templates without proper sanitization or escaping. Specifically, the 'src', 'url', and 'alt' variables, which are derived from 'image' and 'options' objects, are directly inserted into the HTML string that is pushed into the 'items' array. If an attacker can control the content of these variables, they can inject malicious scripts that will be executed when the HTML is rendered in a user's browser.
